Fields.DialogueText: Eh...? What's that whistling noise? Hello? Who's whistling?
Sorry, Captain. I was just relaxing.
It was quite loud.
What can I say? I must have big lungs or something.

Fields.MenuText: What are you doing out here? Shouldn't you be on duty?
With this much time off, you should be preparing for our next fight.
Could you whistle a bit quieter?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm off duty right now. Things have been quiet on board for a while.
Everyone else prepares in their own way. Sometimes I feel best prepared when I've had time to relax before a bout.
Well, that's a little rude... although I suppose the sound does carry.
I suppose a little relaxation wouldn't hurt any of us. The Morganas have been pretty scarce in this area of ocean.
*ALARM*
You sure about that?
I used to be.
@BATTLE
Narwhal, you look awfully energetic.
There are some Morganas headed this direction. From the looks of things, I think this could be a fun battle!
I don't typically think of these battles as being fun.
Are we fighting for our lives? Sure. But I'd much rather do so with a smile on my face, enjoying myself, than acting all serious and sour throughout the whole of the battle.
That's one way of looking at the situation, I suppose.
@BATTLE
Hey, what are you up to today, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Why do you ask?
I have a mountain of paperwork I need to finish.
Just preparing for the next fight.

Fields.DialogueText: A day in the life of a captain has always been one of my curiosities.
Captain duties, oooh. That sounds like fun.
Fight, fight, fight. That's all we seem to do around here.
Narwhal, there's a lot on my plate. Can you pass this to the postal officer for me? I know it's not really your thing to retrieve and send mail, but I just really need to get this done.
Sure. Err, which way is he again?
... Never mind. Here, follow me...
Captain, I found the postal room. But no one was inside, so I just left the letter on the officer's desk.
Had the officer left a note of some sort?
No note. And the room was messy. I mean, really messy. Letters everywhere. Unopened and everything.
Oh, no, I just remembered. The postal worker was injured in our last battle - he's out of commission for the time being.
We'll need to find some other means of having all the ship's packages delivered, I guess.

Fields.MenuText: Narwhal, thank you for bringing this to my attention.
Finding a new postal officer should be toward the top of our list of priorities.
How are we going to do that?

Fields.DialogueText: It's no problem, Captain. Just trying to do my job.
Understood, Captain.
I'll see if someone else wants to deliver the mail. I hear it's quite rewarding when you get down to it.
In the meantime, could you sort through the packages we have here? You have quite a bit of free time, don't you?
I wouldn't necessarily say that. But if it'll help the ship run more smoothly, then I'm up for anything!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Even some uninvited guests...
Action stations, everyone! We've got fish to fry!
@BATTLE
So, Narwhal, how's the new interim job treating you?
I'm trying to make the best of it - but some of the handwriting is so poor, I can hardly make out what's addressed to whom.
I can only imagine.
Still, I'm figuring things out. And I did find this package, addressed to you, Captain.
Why are the edges torn?
I might have gotten a little excited and nearly opened it. But I restrained myself at the last second.

Fields.MenuText: Other captains would send you to the brig for that.
I'm not even going to ask, Narwhal.
Well, at least you got it started for me.

Fields.DialogueText: But we're friends, right? Captain? We're friends?
All will be forgotten once you've opened it, I'm sure.
See? Teamwork is the root of all happiness here.
Hmm... it's an antique statue of a monkey. And there's no return address. Well, this is nice, if a little odd.
I hope someday someone sends me odd antiquities out of the blue.
Of course you do...
Hey! Captain, guess what I found?
I'm busy, Narwhal.
Dun dun dun! It's a letter! It came with your package. It looks as if they were separated during transit.
Well, maybe this will shed a little light on the situation.
"To My Captain. May this statue bring luck to your collection and peace to your mind. Love, M."
Any idea what that means?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe it's from one of my more recent expeditions. A thank you, I guess?
It's eerie. Maybe it's from a relative or something?
I have no idea who it's from.

Fields.DialogueText: You certainly are a popular person.
If I were giving something to my sister, I certainly wouldn't gift something like that.
I'm sure "M" will come to mind soon, Captain.
What should I do with this?
Maybe you can place it on your desk. It'll look so nice next to all of your other things.
I'm not sure how well a monkey statue will go with those things. It's a little... absurd looking.
Then give it here! I'll find a place for it.
*ALARM*
Hold onto it for now. I think there are a few Morganas on the horizon.
@BATTLE
It'll have to wait, Captain. I think those Morganas want to crack us open and take a look at it!
@BATTLE
Status check. Narwhal?
I'm present, Captain. That was some intense battle we just had. I was worried about our chances for a few moments.

Fields.MenuText: You did just fine, Narwhal.
Well, thanks to you, we were able to overcome the enemy.
I was nervous as well, but we pulled through.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Captain. Always trying to do a great job. We've got a war to fight, after all.
No, Captain, I just did my job. We would have been lost without your leadership.
I'm glad we did make it, Captain. I hope we can be stronger for the future.
Now we can get back to decorating.
Well, the thing is, the statue... broke. I had it in my bag during battle, and when the Morgana struck, I fell down, and now it's in a thousand pieces.
What?
Well, maybe not a thousand pieces, but it's definitely destroyed. Here, take a look.
You weren't kidding. Careful, I don't want you hurting yourself on those sharp edges.
Not to worry, Captain. I'll be cautious.
You find a space for the statue?
Okay, Narwhal, it's just us two. What did you want to talk about?
I went back to look at the container the statue was sent to us in, and... it wasn't actually addressed to you.
What do you mean?
Upon further examination, I'm reasonably sure the package was addressed to someone named CAP TANNER. The name was smudged in transit, hence the mistake.
You do know my name isn't actually Captain, right? It's just a title.
Huh. I mean, uh, right. But what should we do about this?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know, Narwhal. This is your responsibility now.
We could track down this Mr. Tanner and figure out what to do from there.
We can just pretend it never happened. No one needs to know.

Fields.DialogueText: My responsibility? Oh gosh, oh gosh...
Great idea. Just tell me what I can do and I'll be happy to help.
Now, Captain, that's not right, is it?
*ALARM*
There's the alarm. Let's reconvene later. For the time being, that statue is the least of our worries.
@BATTLE
I'm collecting glue from everyone on the ship. Captain, do you have any glue?

Fields.MenuText: Why would I have glue?
No, no glue here.
Sure, just check the invisible cabinet over there.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. You're usually so very capable, and, in my mind, capable people always have glue.
Hmm, then I guess I'll search elsewhere.
Captain, sarcasm won't help us win this war, and nor will it help me.
So what do you need the glue for?
I'm trying to fix the statue.
I thought it was in a thousand pieces?
Well, I've collected some of them. Most of them, I think.
Relax, Narwhal. There's no reason to get worked up.
No? I found out a little more about this Cap Tanner fellow. Word is, he's a millionaire.
You're kidding.
And we broke his statue! It's never smart to cross someone with a lot of money.
*ALARM*
True as that may be... we have more immediate threats to worry about at the moment.
@BATTLE
I actually... do... have glue.
See! I told you!
Almost... almost...
@BATTLE
Captain, I think I fixed it!
You did?
Well, sort of. How does this look?

Fields.MenuText: It looks like it's had some work done.
Well, at least you tried.
Is that a monkey?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, at least it's in fewer than a thousand pieces.
It doesn't look that bad, does it?
Hey, don't be rude. I did my best.
It was a good attempt, but let's be honest here. It's still obvious it was broken.
I know. I suppose all that's left to do is write Cap Tanner and let him know what happened... but that's the last thing I want to do.
We could ship it to him and let him think it was broken in transit.
That wouldn't be honest, Captain.
I know. And, realistically, he would likely notice that the seal had been broken. Not to mention that the package is marked as having been delivered to this boat.
Back to square one, I suppose.
*ALARM*
Oh, for the love of... ugh. Stay right there, monkey!
Narwhal. I haven't seen you in a while.
I had some time off, so I decided to spend it by myself and clear my mind a bit. And then I ended up talking to some of the locals at that last dock, the ones who came with things to sell.
Oh, that's nice. Did you do any shopping?
Ha! Take a look at this.

Fields.MenuText: Err, what is it?
Is that what I think it is?
Narwhal, how much did this cost you?

Fields.DialogueText: It's supposed to be a monkey, of course.
A monkey statue? Yes!
Don't worry about the money, Captain.
The thing is, Narwhal, this isn't the statue. It's not even remotely the same.
... Oh! Haha. You're kidding. Great joke, Captain.
I don't even think this is a monkey. It's like some sort of cat-like creature. Monkeys don't have teeth like this, do they?
Well, it's a good thing I kept my receipt.
*ALARM*
Morganas. Better stick that statue in a pillow or something...
@BATTLE
Narwhal, what are you doing up so late?
I'm stressed. I've hardly been able to sleep. This whole Cap Tanner mess is driving me crazy!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, it's not so bad. I'm sure everything will work out.
These things happen.
Yeah, this was a huge mistake. Kind of glad I'm not in your shoes.

Fields.DialogueText: I feel like my problems just get worse and worse.
I guess mistakes are a part of life.
Oh, like you've never messed up in the whole of your life!
All right, Narwhal, think. How do you normally go about fixing your problems?
I determine the best possible solution and I make it happen.
And what is the best possible solution here?
There's only one, so far as I can tell. We have to tell Cap Tanner what happened.
Being honest isn't always the easiest thing - but if it's all you can do, then you don't really have a choice in the matter, do you?
You're not wrong, Captain.
*ALARM*
Cheer up, Narwhal. There are some Morganas headed this way. Feel like taking a few of them down?
Always, Captain.
@BATTLE
Captain, come! Look out there.
Out where?
The port side. See that? Morganas. They keep coming. Over and over again. It's never-ending, isn't it?
No, it's not. It's war, Narwhal.
I'm going to fight hard to defeat them all. We can do this, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Something's different about you today, Narwhal.
We will defeat them. Together.
It's a hard job, but we signed up for this.

Fields.DialogueText: My resolve is strong, Captain. I can feel the energy flowing inside of me.
Captain, I'm awaiting your command.
You're precisely right.
Are you ready to take them on?
Yes! Yes, let's go!
@BATTLE
Do you enjoy fighting, Narwhal? You seemed really gung ho about that last engagement.
Well, that's an odd question. I guess I don't enjoy it as I would a delicious plate of food, but there's something exhilarating about the experience, I think.
What about you?

Fields.MenuText: I don't like fighting, but I'm good at it.
I'll do anything as long as we win.
Fighting is my life.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand. No wants to enter into a battle feeling unprepared.
There's a lot on the line in this war. I can understand that train of thought, Captain.
That's likely what makes you such a good leader in this war. You've dedicated your life to warfare.
*ALARM*
There's the alarm.
What a shock. Ready for another fight?
Of course.
@BATTLE
How's the search coming for a new postal officer, Captain? I wasn't anticipating this position turning into something long term...
That's a shame. The crew has appreciated the work you've put in. You really do have a knack for this sort of thing.
If you say so. By the way, here's a letter for you.

Fields.MenuText: See? What would we do without you?

Fields.DialogueText: Not receive your mail?
*BOOM*
What was that noise?!
@BATTLE
Well, that was a surprise.
Ha, you're telling me. Oh, I almost forgot, the letter. Wait- it's addressed to CAP TANNER. Honestly, Narwhal...
Oh... we already opened the other one, so... might as well?
Not. A. Chance.

Fields.MenuText: It's only temporary, Narwhal. I promise.
You sure you don't want to take over permanently?

Fields.DialogueText: I understand. Until then, I'll do my best!
... Not really.
Shoot... I know there was one around here somewhere...
@BATTLE
Captain, do you have a pen on you?
No, why?
I was thinking of writing my sister a letter.

Fields.MenuText: Good for you. Family is important.
I didn't know you had a sister.
We were just in battle. You should do that later.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks. I care deeply about her. We're very like-minded.
We write each other all the time.
Oh, fine. But I had such a great thing to tell her, and I don't want to forget.
I think there are some pens in the mess.
Thanks! Also, I just read that Cap Tanner is making a sea voyage soon. It said so in the paper.
You're kidding. Why?
I'm not sure. But, I'll see if I can't uncover what's going on!
Good thinking, Narwhal. You're dismissed.
Whatever you're looking for, Narwhal, save it for later. We've got-
Grr! How does anyone find anything at sea if they're fighting all the time?
Any word on Cap Tanner?
Not yet, but I'm sure we'll get something soon. In the meantime, why don't we enjoy this view of the ocean?

Fields.MenuText: It is very nice.
I have better things to do, Narwhal.
Honestly, looking at the water too long makes me a little queasy.

Fields.DialogueText: Seeing nature and beauty like this never gets old for me, no matter how many times we're out at sea.
Sorry, Captain. I forgot how busy you are.
You're... you're not serious, are you, Captain?
How long until our next Morgana attack?
I'm not sure. They're worrying me.
What do you mean?
They've been trying new methods. More undersea tactics.
We'll just have to make sure we're prepared for whatever they throw at us.
@BATTLE
Here come some now. We'll throw things right back!
Looks like we've got company! You invite these girls for a party, Captain?
@BATTLE
What are you looking at, Captain?
This monkey statue... it's a little odd, isn't it?
Let me look at it.

Fields.MenuText: Notice how the pieces are all disproportionate. Strange, no?
The scratches aren't in gold. Maybe this isn't as valuable as we thought.
I didn't mean in any specific way.

Fields.DialogueText: I wonder if that's because I dropped it. No, wait... you're right. It does look odd.
Could this be a fake? No...
Still, you are correct. There does seem to be something strange about the statue.
Hmm... I just wonder where this originally came from.  Narwhal, care to do some research?
I'm on it, Captain! Time to look into this "M" character.
Forgot the hors d'oeuvres. We'll have to improvise.
Captain! I've done some research, some backtracking, but all to no avail.
What about Cap Tanner? Where is he?
Well... he's on his way.
What? What do you mean?
I kind of... invited him here, by accident.

Fields.MenuText: How do you accidentally invite someone!?
Now we're in deep trouble.
Well, I guess it's time to prepare that apology.

Fields.DialogueText: It was an honest mistake, I swear!
Don't worry, I can handle this... I think.
Umm, I'm on it, Captain.
When is Cap Tanner set to arrive?
Not too long from now...
Great...
*ALARM*
CAPTAIN! MORGANAS SIGHTED!
Sigh...
@BATTLE
Don't worry, Captain, we'll think of something.
@BATTLE
Well, Cap Tanner will be here before we know it...
What should we do?
We apologize. Like you said earlier, it's all we can do.

Fields.MenuText: You're right.
A captain never apologizes.
We can explain what happened. We are at war, after all.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll try and figure something out.
I really don't think that's true, Captain.
Yes, but we can't blame the war entirely.
All we can do now is prepare for his arrival. You know what I'm thinking, Narwhal?
We should give him the welcome of a lifetime?
Yes, something along those lines.
I'm on it, Captain!
Maybe we won't have to. There are a fair few Morganas...
Captain! Don't even joke about that.
These are the coordinates. Just like we planned, all right?
@BATTLE
Well, he should be here by now. See anything?
Hmm... not yet.
... Wait.
Is that him?
Hmm, no, it's just a rock. Shaped an awful lot like a capsized ship...
Let me see. It does look like a wreck.
What should we do?

Fields.MenuText: Let sleeping ships lie.
I'm worried it may be a trap.
We go in and find survivors.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll follow your orders, Captain... but we might be obligated.
Smart thinking. There may be more Morganas lying in wait nearby. We ought to proceed with caution.
Onward. Although, I have to say the situation doesn't look particularly promising...
We'll get there when we get there. First we've got to clear him a path.
I don't have a good feeling about that shipwreck.
@BATTLE
Captain!
Yes, Narwhal?
I just discovered... that wrecked ship... it was Cap Tanner's.

Fields.MenuText: What a relief.
Damn those Morganas!
I hope he went peacefully.

Fields.DialogueText: A relief!? Captain, we found no survivors!
I can't believe it either, Captain.
I hope so too. I've sent word to the Naval Protection Force, asking them if there are any steps they wish us to take.
How unfortunate. Well, I'll be in my quarters, Narwhal.
Captain? I'm sorry. We were so busy seeing to the broken statue that I didn't think much about the man who owned it.
Not only that, but who was "M"? We have to figure it out.
Who, indeed...
I don't blame you. It must be kind of like seeing a dead body for a human.
That, and anything that's dead has a killer. If they're around here somewhere..
*ALARM*
Good instinct. Let's move!
Writing home?
@BATTLE
"Mrs. Tanner, I'm deeply sorry for your loss..."
He was married?
I don't know, I'm just preparing anything I can think of.
I can't believe that after all that worrying I did, I'll never have the chance to tell Tanner what happened to his statue...

Fields.MenuText: To think a broken statue caused all this mess. If we hadn't called him...
He's gone, and now we're left picking up the pieces.
We're not at fault. These things happen because of the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. It's sad, but we have to keep moving on. No one feels more responsible than me.
It's the broken places that get stronger. I read that in a book, once.
We'll make sure Cap Tanner didn't die in vain. I'm sure of it.
"Mrs. Tanner, your husband had an eye for beauty in this world..."
Well, I don't know if I'd call that statue "beautiful," but...
Pardon me, would you like to write this?
Would you look at the time? I have that cleaning thing I need to do... all the way over there.
You might say that.
*ALARM*
Damn. I'll have to pick this up later.
Let's see. "Mrs. Tanner..." Ah.
Damn, they just keep coming!
@BATTLE
Captain, look, there's a ship out there!
Is it a Morgana?
No, it doesn't look like one... could they be a friend?

Fields.MenuText: Let's approach them and see what they want.
There's no telling if they're a friend or foe. Stay in one place.
Prepare the armaments. We have to look strong.

Fields.DialogueText: Aye-aye, Captain!
I'll keep a lookout, try to see what they want.
All cannons, prepare to fire. Hold position.
Wait, look at the flag!
Well I'll be. It's an "M."
I suppose the time has come. Narwhal, hand me the statue.
Captain, I'd also like to give M the monkey... cat... animal statue I bought as well, as a symbol of good will.
That's very generous, Narwhal. I'll make sure it's handed over.
Let 'em. I've got a bouquet of torpedoes burning a hole in my pocket!
Oh, Captain, you've returned!
Indeed. Narwhal, where did you actually get that strange statue?
I told you, people come to sell things on the docks. I like collecting things during my travels - I think I have quite the eye. Did M like it?
Yes, she did.
Oh, I'm glad.
She also asked us for one more thing. Revenge.
Revenge? On the Morganas who killed Cap Tanner? And what do you think about that?

Fields.MenuText: I think vengeance isn't something we should go after. But... this time is different.
We attack, but only to defeat the Morgana threat.
Full speed ahead, that's what I say.

Fields.DialogueText: We should do the right thing, Captain, no matter what.
That's right, it's our duty to defeat the Morganas.
I'll notify the crew. Let's go.
Intel says they've split up into two groups. We'll have to fight each battle like it's our last!
@BATTLE
Looks like it's going to be a rough one.
@BATTLE
Narwhal? Narwhal!
I'm over here.
What are you doing overboard? ... Are you swimming?
Just floating.

Fields.MenuText: That looks quite relaxing. You've earned it.
Well, all right, go have fun. I'll leave you to it.
You're a strange individual, Narwhal.

Fields.DialogueText: Would you care to join me?
Wait, no, stay there, Captain. I'll talk.
It's not so bad once you get past the sharks and stuff.
Well, we're setting off soon, so you should come back up.
In a moment, Captain. I like the waters here. I'm just spending one last moment in them before we head off... just one last moment thinking about everything we've experienced.
I have something to give you.
Do you? Hold on.
What is it?
A monkey statue. I picked it up the last time we were at dock. I think you've earned it.
Thank you, Captain. This is... very thoughtful of you. I think I know just the place to put it!

Fields.MenuText: Better make a lot of room. We're going to have a lot more treasure to collect, Narwhal.
Keep it as a memory of Cap Tanner, as a memory of M, and everything they stood for.

Fields.DialogueText: We'll just have to make it rougher on them!
